name: The Cavendish London

reviews.text: This was by far the best of the central London hotels I've stayed in. Great views from the top floors. The hotel is contemporary, stylish and clean. My room was very comfortable and the bath was huge. Staff was great. Always able to answer questions. Breakfast was ok but only because it was included in the rate. Location is wonderful, even with nearby tube stobs shut down. My new home for business travel to central London!
reviews.title: Loved it!
Great Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel is a definite. It was more money than we wanted to spend, but we loved it. Super sleek and cool. The staff was young, hip, friendly, and helpful. Small room, but very clean and modern. The bed was very comfortable and they had a great stereo in the room. Perfectly located, we walked so many places and its only 3 minutes from a Tube stop. Breakfast in the morning was very nice. We would stay there again.

reviews.title: Great location, Awful Uniforms
reviews.text: Found this hotel on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. The location is great, the rooms are stylish, the staff friendly (although as is usual in London very young and inexperienced. Someone asked where the Royal Academy was and neither person on reception had any idea. It is a huge prominent building about 50 metres away!).

reviews.title: very stylish
reviews.text: I would certainly recommend the hotel. One minor downside, in an attempt to be trendy they have dispensed with the usual suits and ties. I like staff to be smart and prefer the traditional look but if people want something new that's fine but dressing the staff in what look like white jogging bottoms looks absolutely terrible and gives a very unprofessional image. Shame.

description: Located on prestigious Jermyn Street in the heart of Piccadilly, The Cavendish London offers the ultimate in luxury and convenience for visitors to the UK's Capital, whether for business or for pleasure. In the Edwardian era The Cavendish London, was run by Rosa Lewis the infamous "Duchess of Duke St". Famous throughout London Society for hospitality and cooking, The Cavendish London, continues this tradition today - the attentive staff, variety of facilities and the meticulous care in all the services offered will ensure your stay is as enjoyable as possible.
